alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 11:58PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall will continue. * WHERE...Portions of central New York and northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in central New York, Broome, Chenango and Cortland. In northeast Pennsylvania, Susquehanna and Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1155 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain during the past several hours. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of only up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area, but this along with earlier rainfall will result in continued minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Binghamton, Cortland, Johnson City, Endicott, Tunkhannock, Montrose, Marathon, Greater Binghamton Airport, Falls, Vestal, Kirkwood, Conklin, Rush, Guilford, Sanford, Virgil, Susquehanna, Forest City, Nanticoke and Coventry. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
